results.description: HPV infection can cause oral, cervical, anal, and other cancers. High-risk HPV 16 and HPV 18 cause most HPV-related cancers. Information and video answer questions: What is HPV? How is HPV transmitted? Does HPV infection cause symptoms? How does HPV cause cancer? Who should get the HPV vaccine?
results.title: HPV and Cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study showing that the HPV vaccine Gardasil may sharply reduce oral HPV infections linked to oropharyngeal cancer.
results.title: HPV Vaccine May Prevent Oral HPV Infection - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Pap tests detect abnormal cervical cells, including precancerous cervical lesions, as well as early cervical cancers. HPV tests detect HPV infections that can cause cervical cell abnormalities. Learn how Pap and HPV tests are done, how often testing should be done, and how are HPV test results are reported.
results.title: HPV and Pap Testing - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Following the release of a consensus statement from the NCI-Designated Cancer Centers urging HPV vaccination in the United States, Dr. Noel Brewer discusses the country’s low vaccination rates and how clinicians can help to improve them.
results.title: The HPV Vaccination Crisis - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Oral HPV infections cause over 70% of all oropharyngeal cancers in the United States, and rates of these cancers in men have skyrocketed in recent decades. In a new study of adults aged 18‒59, the rate of HPV vaccination rose from 0% to 6% for men, while oral HPV infections fell by 37% among unvaccinated men.
results.title: HPV Vaccine Herd Immunity against Oral HPV Infections in Men - National Cancer Institute

results.description: On Sunday, March 4, NCI joins organizations around the world, to promote awareness and education about HPV infection and the HPV-associated diseases that can be prevented through vaccination.
results.title: HPV Awareness Day - National Cancer Institute

results.description: A fact sheet about human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines for the prevention of infection with certain types of HPV, which is the major cause of cervical cancer.
results.title: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccines - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Infection with human papillomavirus (HPV) types targeted by the quadrivalent HPV vaccine has declined by nearly two-thirds among teenage girls since HPV vaccination was recommended in the United States.
results.title: HPV Infections Decrease in the U.S. - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Cervical cancer can be prevented with HPV vaccines. NCI-supported researchers helped establish HPV as a cause of cervical cancer. They also helped create the first HPV vaccines, were involved in the vaccine trials, and contribute to ongoing studies.
results.title: Preventing Cervical Cancer with HPV Vaccines - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The NCI Center for Global Health extends its congratulations on Pink Ribbon Red Ribbon’s fifth anniversary and continues to build on its three-year partnership. We look forward to participating in PRRR fifth-anniversary-related activities.
results.title: CGH Roundtable on HPV Screening - National Cancer Institute
